description: Description: RPI Circle K International Community Services will be selling Holiday Candy Grams for only $1 each! Stop by the table in the Union West Lobby from 10am-5pm on Wednesday December 3rd, through Friday December 5th, to make and send a candy gram to your friends! All proceeds go towards supporting the education of children at Hope 7 Community Center.
title: Circle K to Hold Candy Gram Fundraiser

description: Description: RPI-Sage Hillel hosts a shabbat dinner for the whole student and faculty community. Food is home cooked and served at no cost. Optional services start at 5:30pm, dinner starts at 6:00pm. Newcomers are always welcome!
title: Hillel to Host Shabbat Dinner

description: Description: Designed to guide participants along the difficult terrain of financial mathematics in order to support their exploration and learning of the various theories of quantitative and mathematical finance, this IWQF workshop will help participants obtain a good hands-on learning experience in different topics of quantitative finance.
title: Rensselaer to Host 6th International Workshop on Quantitative Finance

description: Description: Don't miss out on your chance at a piece of the $15,000 in cash prizes.This competition is developmental in nature to prepare students to enter the global circuit of business plan competitions.Students will learn to break down their idea into the key business model assumptions, get outside the building and test those assumptions in the marketplace and learning from the failures/successes of those tests. Submit your business model canvas before midnight on Jan 30.
title: Lally Issues Call for Entries for RPI Business Model Competition

description: Description: speaker Dr. David Woodruff from IBM's Almaden Research Center will present "Sketching as a Tool for Numerical Linear Algebra."  Refreshments will be served at 2:30 p.m.
title: Computer Science Colloquium to be Held December 15

description: Description: Jointly hosted by Rensselaer's Computer Science department and Network Science and Technology Center, this colloquium will feature speaker Radosaw Michalski from the Wrocawska University of Technology, who will present, "The Spread of Influence in Temporal Social Networks."  Refreshments will be served at 2:30 p.m.
title: Computer Science, NeST to Host Joint Colloquium

description: Description: Do you have a business concept? Are you ready to move it forward? Mark your calendars for the RPI Business Model Competition, and let us know you're interested in competing by sending a brief description of your business idea!You must be a Rensselaer student for at least one semester in the 2014-2015 academic year to participate.
title: Intents to Submit Now Being Accepted for RPI Business Model Competition

description: The Rensselaer Orchestra, under the direction of Nicholas DeMaison, presents its annual Fall concert.
title: Rensselaer Orchestra Fall Concert Among Upcoming iEAR Events

description: Description: Distinguished artist-in-residence Laurie Anderson presents a feature film in the form of a personal essay, with an original soundtrack of new music and a discussion following the screening.
title: Laurie Anderson to Present New Film at EMPAC

description: Description:RPI-Sage Hillel will be hosting a shabbat dinner for the whole student and faculty community. The food is home-cooked and served at no cost, and newcomers are always welcome! Optional services start at 5:30pm; dinner starts at 6:00pm.
title: Hillel to Host Shabbat Dinner

description: The first Music and Science presentation will take place at the CBIS auditorium from noon to 1:00 Nov. 20th featuring Shakir Khan demonstrating the practice of aural transmission in Guru/Shishya Parampara, the tradition and lineage of knowledge in Hindustani classical music.    Khan will also perform a concert at CBIS Nov. 21st at 7:00 pm
title: HASS, CBIS to Hold First "Music and Science" Presentation and Concert

description: Description: Dr. Tugrul Ozel of Rutgers University will present "Integrated Physics Based Modeling and Multi-objective Optimization Approach for Micro-milling Titanium Alloy."
title: Dept. of MANE Colloquium Scheduled for December 3

description: Description: Speaker Dr. Dominic Di Tori of NAE, will present "Modern Models for Predicting Partitioning, Bioconcentration, and Toxicity of Organic Chemicals: The End of the Age of Octanol"
title: C & EE Seminar to be Held December 10

description: Description: As part of their end-of-term celebration, student creative writers will be reading excerpts of their short story work.   This event is free and open to the public, and all are welcome to attend!  Refreshments will be served.
title: Student Writers to Mark End of Semester with Short Story Readings
